bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 161, Number 98 (Thursday, June 18, 2015)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. GOODLATTE:H.R. 2832.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 18 of the Constitution.Article I, Section 8, Clause 18 of the Constitution conferson Congress the authority to make all laws necessary andproper for carrying into execution the powers vested by theConstitution in the government of the United States, or inany department or officer thereof. This legislation makestechnical amendments to update statutory references tocertain provisions classified to title 52, United StatesCode, as necessary to keep the title current and maketechnical corrections and improvements. Making revisions tothe United States Code is a necessary role of Congress withrespect to executing the powers vested by the Constitution inthe government of the United States.[Page H4543]

item.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote. (text: CR H5057-6062)
Passed/agreed to in House: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.(text: CR H5057-6062)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2832.
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR H5057-5063)
Mr. Goodlatte moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

item.title: H.R. 2832, a bill to make technical amendments to update statutory references to certain provisions classified to title 52, United States Code
item.description: As ordered reported by the House Committee on the Judiciary on December 2, 2015

summary.text:
This bill makes technical amendments to the U.S. Code with respect to title 52 (Voting and Elections), especially:

  • uniformed and overseas citizens absentee voting,

  • voting accessibility for the elderly and handicapped,

  • election administration, and

  • federal election campiagn finance.

This bill makes technical amendments to the U.S. Code with respect to title 52 (Voting and Elections), especially:

  • uniformed and overseas citizens absentee voting,

  • voting accessibility for the elderly and handicapped,

  • election administration, and

  • federal election campaign finance.

bill.title: To make technical amendments to update statutory references to certain provisions classified to title 52, United States Code.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
